snippet: President Hamid Karzai requested a stop to all international airstrikes in his nation, branding them as an “illegitimate use of force” and saying that civilians needed to be protected.
abstract: Afghanistan's Pres Hamid Karzai issues an impassioned call for the end of international airstrikes in his country, calling them an illegitimate use of force and saying civilians need to be protected; Gen John R Allen, allied commander in Afghanistan, reiterates significant changes to rules concerning the use of airstrikes, while warning that strikes will continue to be permitted as an absolute resort in self-defense.

byline.original: By SANGAR RAHIMI and ALISSA J. RUBIN
byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi reported from Kabul, and Alissa J. Rubin from Kunduz, Afghanistan. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Hamid Karzai requested a stop to all international airstrikes in his nation, branding them as an “illegitimate use of force” and saying that civilians needed to be protected.

headline.seo: Afghan President Calls for an End to Airstrikes
headline.main: Days After an Order to Restrict Them, Afghanistan Calls for Airstrikes to End
headline.print_headline: Days After an Order to Restrict Them, Afghanistan Calls for Airstrikes to End
